tourName: Birds of Prey photography holiday in Estonia
generalInfo:
Discover Estonia - an under-the-radar gem for nature photographers. On this immersive seven-day tour designed to capture the country’s rich biodiversity and serene landscapes at the height of spring activity. From ancient forests and misty bogs to quiet coastlines and medieval towns, this experience offers a rare blend of wildlife encounters, scenic beauty, and cultural texture.

The journey begins in western Estonia, where you’ll settle into the Haapsalu area and enjoy a relaxed welcome dinner before heading out for a sunset shoot or a chance to spot the elusive Ural owl.

Early the next morning, you’ll photograph lekking birds such as black grouse and capercaillie, followed by a full day exploring Matsalu National Park - one of Europe’s top wetland birding destinations. Expect godwits, cranes, woodpeckers, and more, with a picnic dinner during a boat safari along the Kasari River, where elk and beavers often make an appearance.

Midweek, the focus shifts to raised bogs and intimate hide sessions. You’ll explore Kõveri’s landscapes and rotate through small hides targeting cranes, waders, and ruffs. These hides are designed for two people, allowing for quiet, focused shooting and close-range wildlife photography. The following day is dedicated to the Krootuse bird hide, where you’ll spend uninterrupted hours capturing forest birds in natural light. That evening, you’ll settle into Käbliku Farm - a peaceful countryside retreat with simple comforts and a warm local feel.

One of the tour’s highlights is the overnight stay in the Alutaguse bear hide, located in one of Europe’s most reliable regions for photographing brown bears. Here, you’ll also have the chance to capture raccoon dogs, red squirrels, and possibly wild boar or elk. The hide offers a rare opportunity for close encounters in a controlled, ethical setting.

As the tour winds down, you’ll head north to Lahemaa National Park, known for its waterfalls, coastal forests, and Baltic seascapes. A boat trip offers the chance to photograph seals and seabirds, or, if weather prevents, the focus will shift to dramatic landscapes and forest textures.

The final day is spent in Tallinn, where a guided photography walk through the medieval old town provides architectural contrast and cultural depth to round out your portfolio.

Throughout the tour, meals are arranged to suit the rhythm of photography -early breakfasts, field lunches, and relaxed dinners. Accommodations are clean and comfortable, chosen for their proximity to nature and quiet charm. With small group sizes and professional photographic guidance, this tour is ideal for photographers who appreciate variety, intimacy, and the chance to explore Estonia’s wilderness at its most vibrant.

dayInfo.description: Begin your Estonian photography adventure with arrival in Tallinn, followed by a scenic transfer to the Haapsalu region on the country’s tranquil west coast. After settling into your accommodation, you’ll meet your guide and fellow photographers for a relaxed introduction to the week ahead. As the day winds down, head out for your first shoot - capturing sunset landscapes or, if conditions allow, seeking out the elusive Ural owl in the surrounding woodlands.

Begin the day with an early morning photography session focused on Estonia’s iconic springtime birdlife. Capture dynamic displays from black grouse, capercaillie, cranes, and woodpeckers in the soft dawn light. After breakfast, the adventure continues with a full day exploring the expansive wetlands of Matsalu National Park, renowned for its rich biodiversity and scenic beauty. In the late afternoon, embark on a tranquil Kasari River boat trip, offering opportunities to photograph elk, beavers, and a variety of wetland birds. A relaxed picnic dinner on board rounds out the day in nature.

Begin the day with a focused bird photography session, capturing early light and active species before transferring to Kõveri, a region known for its pristine natural beauty. Spend the afternoon exploring Estonia’s iconic raised bogs—vast, open landscapes rich in texture and atmosphere. You’ll also rotate through a series of intimate wildlife hides, offering close-up opportunities to photograph cranes, waders, and ruffs in their natural habitats. It’s a day that blends quiet observation with striking, minimalist scenery - perfect for photographers who appreciate subtlety and stillness in their compositions.

Spend a full day in a peaceful forest hide, ideal for photographing woodpeckers, small songbirds, and red squirrels. With unhurried time and natural light, it’s a perfect setup for capturing detailed behavior and quiet moments. The day ends with a cozy overnight stay at a countryside farmhouse.

Enjoy a final morning shoot at the Krootuse hide, then journey east to Alutaguse, one of Europe’s most dependable regions for observing brown bears. As evening approaches, settle into a dedicated overnight bear hide, where you’ll have the chance to photograph bears, raccoon dogs, and other forest wildlife in the soft, fading light.

After breakfast, head into Lahemaa National Park, one of Estonia’s most scenic regions. Spend the day photographing waterfalls, moss-covered forest interiors, and sweeping northern coastline views. In the evening, enjoy an early dinner before setting out on a coastal boat trip to capture seals and seabirds in golden light - weather permitting. Overnight stay in Lahemaa.

Return to Tallinn for a guided photography walk through the city’s medieval old town, where cobbled streets, historic facades, and soft Baltic light offer rich opportunities for architectural and street photography. Enjoy a relaxed farewell lunch with the group before airport transfers or your optional extra night in Tallinn.
